item.title: Mach-Nix and Shell Environments
item.description: I often need to set up quick virtual environments. Unfortunately, the standard approach to work with this in nix deals with the local nixpkgs mechanism for python dependencies: nix-shell -p "python38.withPackages(ps: [ ps.numpy ps.sh ])" However there is a catch for packages which are not officially present upstream. # Fails! nix-shell -p "python38.withPackages(ps: [ ps.numpy ps.sh ps.lieer ])" However, the mach-nix project can indeed be used to work around this, at the cost of a somewhat longer command.
